label: DataSets
definition: The root element of the schema. A container element for one or more datasets. It allows the handling of several different datasets with a single response operation.

label: DataSet
definition: A container element for one to many unit data records and their shared metadata elements. The metadata relate to the source, provision, ownership, and rights etc. of the entire dataset.

label: DatasetGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the entire data collection (database, dataset) from which the present dataset was derived (the present dataset may be the result of a query).

label: DatasetID
definition: Code or Identifier of the dataset (unique within the institution)

label: TechnicalContacts
definition: Container element for the technical contacts responsilbe for the data set.

label: TechnicalContact
definition: A technical contact normally representing the agent acting as the publisher of the dataset in the network.

label: preferred
definition: A flag set to indicate the preferred technial contact.

label: Name
definition: The name of a technical contact person, person team, or role (e.g. Webmaster) for the dataset.

label: Email
definition: Email address for the technical contact for the dataset.

label: Phone
definition: Phone number for the technical contact for the dataset.

label: Address
definition: Postal address for the technical contact for the dataset.

label: ContentContacts
definition: A container element for several administrative contacts for the dataset.

label: ContentContact
definition: An administrative contact usually representing the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset.

label: preferred
definition: A flag set to indicate the preferred administrative contact.

label: Name
definition: Administrative contact person, person team, or role for the dataset.

label: Email
definition: Email address for the administrative contact for the dataset.

label: Phone
definition: Phone number for the administrative contact for the dataset.

label: Address
definition: Postal address for the administrative contact for the dataset.

label: OtherProviders
definition: Other known on-line providers of this dataset.

label: OtherProvider
definition: The UUID (identifier in the UDDI registry) of another data provider known to serve this dataset.

label: Metadata
definition: Metadata referring to the principal source of the entire data collection (the metadata scope may be wider than the objects actually contained in the data set). In its current form, this collection represents a mixture of elements useful for resource discovery (e.g. scope) with metadata actually pertaining to the received (partial) dataset.

label: Description
definition: Dublin Core conformant elements describing the content of the data source queried, representation in different languages possible

label: Representation
definition: The description in a specified language. Only one representation should be delivered for each language.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Title
definition: A short concise title for the dataset.
examples: Herbarium Berolinense, Berlin (B); 2015 Wildlife Survey on the Banks Peninsula, New Zealand

label: Details
definition: Free-form text containing a longer description of the data source

label: Coverage
definition: Free-form text terminology or descriptions available in the data source (geographic, taxonomic, etc.).

label: URI
definition: The URL that points to an online source related to the data source, which may or may not serve as an updated version of the description data.

label: IconURI
definition: The URL of an icon/logo symbolizing the data source.

label: Scope
definition: Keyword list describing the scope of the data source.

label: GeoecologicalTerms
definition: A collection of terms describing the geoecological scope of the source queried by means of area names.
examples: World; Germany; Atlantic Ocean; Andes; Mountains

label: GeoEcologicalTerm
definition: An area name describing the or part of the geoecological scope of the source queried.
examples: World; Americas; Atlantic Ocean; Andes; Mountains

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: TaxonomicTerms
definition: A container for taxonomic terms describing the data source. This may include scientific and common names of groups of organisms.

label: TaxonomicTerm
definition: A scientific or common taxon name of higher rank, or another term for a group of organisms that serves to describe the - or part of the - taxonomic scope of the source queried. A list of recommended terms should be developed.

label: language
definition: The language of the taxonomic term.
usage:
The value LA should be used for scientific names of organism groups formed in accordance with the respective Code of Nomenclature. 

The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Version
definition: The number and date of the current version of the data source (particularly for citing purposes).

label: Major
definition: The major version number of the data source as defined by the content creators.

label: Minor
definition: An optional minor version number for the data source.

label: Modifier
definition: Unconstrained text specifying a status and an optional number for the data souce version. If this information is missing, release status is assumed.

label: DateIssued
definition: Publication date of the current dataset version. This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published

label: RevisionData
definition: Creators, revision status, and dates of the entire data source from which the current dataset is derived.

label: Creators
definition: Author(s) or editor(s) of the data source.

label: Contributors
definition: Contributers or translators for the data source.

label: DateCreated
definition: Date/time when the data source was created.

label: DateModified
definition: The last modification date for the data source. Source for the Dublin-Core element Date.Modified. If the provider cannot assess this for online data sources, the current date/time may be substituted. For legacy data this may be set to the file date of imported data, or estimated.

label: Owners
definition: A container element for several owners of the data source.

label: Owner
definition: An entity having legal possession of the entire data source content. If an owner statement is present on the unit level, it should override this dataset-level statement.

label: Organisation
definition: Organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the data source.

label: OrganisationGUID
definition: The unique reference number GUID (global unique identifier) of the data source owner organisation.

label: Name
definition: Container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the data source owner.
examples: en: Botanical Garden of ...; de: Botanischer Garten von ...

label: Representation
definition: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the data collection owner. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Text
definition: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection.

label: Abbreviation
definition: Label abbreviation representing the organisation of the legal owner of the data collection. Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: OrgUnits
definition: A container element for several organisation units that the collection owner represents or to which the collection owner may belong. (vCard: Org-Unit)

label: OrgUnit
definition: The organisational unit acting as the data source owner or with which the owner is associated. This is compatible with vcard "Org-Unit".

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Person
definition: Person contact representing the owner of the data collection.

label: FullName
definition: The name of person as normally used representing the data collection's legal owner. The name may include titles.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. Mctrace

label: SortingName
definition: The full name of the data collection's owner in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. The form consists of the following: inherited name (western cultures: lastname) followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space (vCard: Sort-String).

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomized name of the data collection's owner.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the data collection owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the data collection owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition: The suffix for the name of the data collection owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the data collection's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the owner of the data collection. The preferred name may differ from the first given name  (vCard: Nickname).

label: Roles
definition: A container element for several roles of the owner of the data collection.

label: Role
definition: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the data collection. This element can be used to provide a title when no individual person is named.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Addresses
definition: A container element for several contact addresses for the data collection owner (person or organisation).

label: Address
definition: A string representing the address of the data collection owner (person or organisation). The attribute @preferred is used to indicate the preferred postal address.

label: preferred
definition: The address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other addresses named should be regarded as alternate addresses.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: TelephoneNumbers
definition: A container element for several telephone and fax numbers for the owner of the data collection (person or organisation).

label: TelephoneNumber
definition: Telephone or fax number for the legal owner of the data collection.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number"). \n\nThe preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

label: preferred
definition: The telephone number marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other telephone numbers should be regarded as alternative numbers.

label: Number
definition: Full telephone or fax number of the owner of the data collection.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").

label: Device
definition: The type of device reached by the telephone number of the data collection owner.

label: UsageNotes
definition: Free text describing constraints on use of the telephone number of the legal owner of the data collection.

label: language

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: EmailAddresses
definition: A container element for several contact email addresses for the owner of the data collection (person or organisation).

label: EmailAddress
definition:
A valid contact email address for the owner of the data collection.

The @preferred attribute indicates a preferred email address.

label: preferred
definition: The email address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other email addresses named should be regarded as alternative email addresses.

label: URIs
definition: A container element for several URLs for websites representing the owner of the data collection (person or organisation).

label: URI
definition:
Publicly available URL for the person or organisation representing the legal owner of the data collection.

The @preferred attribute indicates the main URL.

label: preferred
definition: The URL marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first used. The other URLs named should be regarded as alternative URLs.

label: LogoURI
definition: The URL of a logo image of the item or holding organisation representing the owner of the data source. The logo image may give a quick indication of the source in result sets comprising data from several datasets.

label: IPRStatements
definition: A sequence of statements related to intellectual property rights, credit and acknowledgements for the dataset. This can be used as source for the Darwin Core element "Rights". Giving a copyright statement and a licence is highly recommended!
examples: copyright; terms of use; license; disclaimer or acknowledgement

label: IPRDeclarations
definition: A container element for several IPR declarations for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: IPRDeclaration
definition: IPR declaration for the dataset that is used when the IPR declaration cannot be parsed into the specific items or for forms of IPR declaration not yet covered (e.g. database rights).

label: Text
definition: A concise representation of an IPR statement related to the dataset. It is recommended that this be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

label: Details
definition: Details related to the IPR declaration for the dataset. This is optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the IPR declaration text.

label: URI
definition: An optional resource on the net providing details related to the IPR declaration for the database. This element may be used as an alternative to the long text.

label: Copyrights
definition: A container element for several copyright statements for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: Copyright
definition: A copyright statement for the dataset. The copyright may include the information that the data has been released to the public domain.

label: Details
definition: Details related to the copyright declaration for the dataset. This is optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the copyright declaration Text.

label: URI
definition: An optional resource on the net providing details related to the copyright declaration for the database. This element may be used as an alternative to the long text.

label: Licenses
definition: A container element for several license statements for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: License
definition: A license statement for the dataset. This element is to be used if data are placed under a public license. Placing data under a public license while maintaining copyright is recommended!

label: TermsOfUseStatements

label: TermsOfUseStatement
definition: A terms of use statement for the dataset. This statement defines conditions under which the data may be analised, distributed or changed.

label: Details
definition: Details related to the terms of use declaration for the dataset. This is optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the terms of use declaration Text.

label: URI
definition: An optional resource on the net providing details related to the terms-of-use declaration for the database. This element may be used as an alternative to the long text.

label: Disclaimers
definition: A container element for several disclaimer statements for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: Disclaimer
definition: A disclaimer statement for the dataset.
examples: statement concerning responsibility for data quality or legal implications

label: Text
definition: A concise representation of the disclaimer for the dataset. It is recommended that this be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

label: Acknowledgements
definition: A container element for several acknowledgements for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: Acknowledgement
definition: A free form text acknowledging support for the dataset.
examples: grant money; help; permission to reuse published material; etc.

label: Citations
definition: A container element for several citations for the dataset, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

label: Citation
definition: A citation for the dataset, indicating how this dataset or record should be attributed if used [OBIF 1.0].

label: DirectAccessURI
definition: An electronic source of the dataset.

label: Units
definition: A container for one or more unit data records from the gathering project.

label: Unit
definition: A container for all data referring to a unit (specimen or observation record).

label: UnitGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier for the unit (i.e. the physical specimen or original observation).

label: SourceInstitutionID
definition: Unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source (first part of record identifier). In specimen collections, this is normally the institution or private holder of the collection itself. For herbaria and botanical gardens, the standard abbreviations should be used.

label: SourceID
definition: Name or code of the data source (unique within the institution, second part of the record identifier)

label: UnitID
definition: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. Preferably, the ID should be stable in the database, so that it also can be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). Third part of the record identifier.

label: UnitIDNumeric
definition:
The Numeric catalogue number for the unit.

Where present, the unit catalogue number facilitates sorting and allows for searches on a range of catalogue numbers.

label: LastEditor
definition: Name or other indication of the person or team that created or last edited this record.

label: DateLastEdited
definition: Date of creation or last change of this unit record.

label: Owner
definition: The legal owner of the unit record.

label: Organisation
definition: Contact organisation for the legal owner of the unit record.

label: OrganisationGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the organisation or organisational unit

label: Name
definition: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages . (vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).
examples: en: Botanical Garden of ...; de: Botanischer Garten von ...

label: Representation
definition: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the owner of the unit record. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

label: Abbreviation

label: OrgUnit

label: Person
definition: Person representing the owner of the unit record.

The name of person as normally used representing the legal owner of the unit record.

The name may include titles.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition: The full name of the owner of the unit record in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically (vCard: Sort-String). The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomised name of the owner of the unit record.

examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition:
The full name of the administrative contact for the unit record in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomized name of the administrative contact for the unit record.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the administrative contact for the unit record. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the unit record administrative contact's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition:
The suffix for the name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the administrative contact for the unit record. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

Published reference from where the information on this unit originated.

See Source-Reference for the case that the record is based on a publication.

label: UnitReference
definition: A published reference citing this unit.

label: ReferenceGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the reference.

label: TitleCitation
definition: A formal citation for a paper or electronic publication citing this unit.

label: CitationDetail
definition: The specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference citing this unit.

label: URI
definition: The URL to an electronic source of the reference citing this unit.

label: DOI
definition: Digital object identifier (DOI) to an electronic source of the reference citing this unit.

label: Identifications
definition: A container element for several identification events for the unit, (i.e. the circumstances and result of assigning a name or other classification to the unit).

label: Identification
definition: Assignation of a scientific or vernacular name or material classification to the unit. In cases where more than one name applies to a single unit, several identifications should be formed and flagged as preferred. Relationships between differently identified sub-units of the unit can be specified by means of the Identification-Role.

label: Result
definition: The result of the unit identification, currently either a material (substrate) or a taxon name. In the future to be extended to include other types of identifications used in natural history collections and surveys.

label: TaxonIdentified
definition: The Taxon (concept) or Taxonomic name assigned to the unit (or excluded, "non") in the identification event.

label: HigherTaxa
definition: A container element for several designations of higher taxa used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event.

label: HigherTaxon
definition: The scientific name and rank of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus that is used by the data source to classify the taxon name assigned to the unit in the identification event. Although this is not really within the scope of ABCD's data domain, this item is kept for compatibility reasons (Darwin Core) and because for the time being searches are often executed using this item (although classification may vary considerably in source datasets). Eventually, we hope that this function will largely be replaced by taxon and name services defined and provided elsewhere. It is highly recommended to make use of the rank element, because this is a prerequisit for data transformation to Darwin Core.

label: HigherTaxonName
definition: A generic or higher taxon name (monomial) in accordance with rules of nomenclature and associated with the identified taxon. This is not necessarily the result of the identification event, but a classification added to the result of the identification in the source database.

label: HigherTaxonRank
definition:
The rank designation of the associated higher taxon (above the rank of genus). The fully spelled out rank value (in latin but for the "unranked" term and the "group" levels). This can be used as metadata for any name for a taxon of rank above the genus-level.
It is strongly recommended to use this element, since a rank value is required in order to transform ABCD data for higher taxa to Darwin Core.

label: ScientificName
definition: The name of the taxon identified in the unit identification, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names (with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications).

label: FullScientificNameString
definition: A concatenated scientific name given as the result of the unit identification, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature as fully as possible (i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author[s] or author team[s] and - where relevant - year, or the full name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula or named hybrid).

label: NameAtomised
definition:
Atomised data items of the taxon identified for the unit, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

Mandatory (at least one) for unit identifications.

label: Botanical
definition: Atomised botanical name formed in the unit identification, with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, identified for the unit:

A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules: First letter capitalised; No spaces included.

label: FirstEpithet
definition:
The first epithet in a botanical name combination that was identified for the unit (i.e. the epithet of a genus subdivision or a species epithet).

The specific epithet portion of the scientific name, in latin, in lowercase letters. The abbreviation "sp." is allowed.
A
Rules:

1 No uppercase

2. No space

label: InfraspecificEpithet
definition:
The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank identified for the unit.

The infraspecific epithet (i.e. the epithet following the indication of the infraspecific rank in the name string (trinomial)).

Subtaxa can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier, in latin. Following abbreviations are allowed: "subsp." (for subspecies); "convar." (for convariety); "var." (for variety); "f." (for form).

Rules:

1 No uppercase

2. No space

label: Rank
definition:
The rank of the name identified for the unit, where needed to form it. (i.e. in infraspecies and in names of a rank between genus and species).

Subtaxa can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier, in latin. Following abbreviations are allowed: "subsp." (for subspecies); "convar." (for convariety); "var." (for variety); "f." (for form).

label: HybridFlag
definition: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid ("x") or a graft chimaera ("+").

label: insertion point
definition: This attribute specifies the name element in front of which the hybrid flag should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before rank designation for second epithet.)

label: AuthorTeamParenthesis
definition:
Author team of the basionym of a combination identfied for the unit.

If the second epithet is empty, this is the authority for the species name. Otherwise this is the subtaxa authority at the most detailed taxonomic level (e.g.(Waldst. et Kit.) Arc.

Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet. May be preceded by a sanctioning author. If possible, preceding "ex" authors should be avoided.

label: AuthorTeam
definition:
The author(s) who published the full name as it stands that was identified for the unit.

If the second epithet is empty, this is the authority for the species name. Otherwise this is the subtaxa authority at the most detailed taxonomic level (e.g.(Waldst. et Kit.) Arc.

Author(s) for the taxonomic name combination (i.e. the author team of the new combination where there is a basionym, and the name author team where there is none). May be preceded by a sanctioning author. If possible, preceding "ex" authors should be avoided.

label: CultivarGroupName
definition: The cultivar group name that was identified for the unit, as specified in the ICNCP (International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants).

label: CultivarName
definition:
A cultivar name identified for the unit, as specified by the ICNCP (International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants).

For output, cultivar names must be enclosed in single quotes.

Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
examples: Firmgold; Granny Smith; Sturmer Pippin; Rheinische Vorgebirgstrauben; Emma; Avlon

label: TradeDesignationNames
definition: A container for several trade names identified for the unit.

label: TradeDesignationName
definition:
A trade name used for a specific cultivar that was identified for the unit, as specified by the ICNCP.

Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession. First letter uppercase. Multiple names separated with semicolon without space. FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.

label: Bacterial
definition: Atomized bacterial name formed in the unit identification with elements according to the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
A generic name as a bacterial scientific name or as part of it identified for the unit.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: Subgenus
definition:
A subgenus name as (part of) a bacterial scientific name identified for the unit.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: SubgenusAuthorAndYear
definition: Author and year of the subgenus name identified for the unit.

label: SpeciesEpithet
definition: The first epithet occurring in a bacterial name (after genus and, optionally, subgenus names) identified for the unit.

label: SubspeciesEpithet
definition: The second epithet of a bacterial name of subspecies rank (after Genus, optional subgenus, and species epithet) identified for the unit.

label: ParentheticalAuthorTeamAndYear
definition: Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies combination identified for the unit. Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet.

label: AuthorTeamAndYear
definition:
The author(s) who published the full name as it stands and its year that was identified for the unit.

Author(s) for the taxonomic name combination (i.e. the author team of the new combination where there is a basionym, and the name author team where there is none).
examples: Yamada and Kondo; Ames and Correll

label: NameApprobation
definition: Approbation of the name identified for the unit according to an approved list, validation list,or validly published, paper in IJSB after 1980.

label: Viral
definition: Atomised viral name formed in the unit identification, with elements according to the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
Genus or higher taxon name formed according to the code and representing the result of the identification.

A generic name as a scientific name of a virus or as part of it.

Rules: First letter capitalised; No spaces included.

label: ViralSpeciesDesignation
definition: The formal name of a viral species that is the result of the unit identification. (Examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1 [Source: ICTV]).
examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1

label: Acronym
definition: The accepted acronym for the virus identified for the unit.

label: Zoological
definition: Atomized zoological name formed in the unit identification with elements according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
A generic name as a zoological scientific name or as part of it that was identified for the unit.

Rules

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: Subgenus
definition:
A subgenus name as a zoological scientific name or as part of it that was identified for the unit.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included

label: SpeciesEpithet
definition: The first epithet occurring in a zoological name that was identified for the unit (after genus and, optionally, subgenus names).

label: SubspeciesEpithet
definition: The second epithet of a zoological name of subspecies rank that was identified for the unit(after genus, optional subgenus, and species epithet).

label: AuthorTeamOriginalAndYear
definition:
The original authors and year of publication of the name identified for the unit.

The first person(s) who validly published a species-group name and the year of publication.

label: AuthorTeamParenthesisAndYear
definition:
The parenthetical author and year of publication for a name identified for the unit.

The parenthetical citation of the original author when a species-group was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication for a name identified for the unit.

Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet and the year of the original publication.

Rule: Set in parenthesis upon output

label: CombinationAuthorTeamAndYear
definition: The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination identified for the unit, and the year of its publication or when a species-group is transferred to another genus and the year of publication of  the transfer.

label: Breed
definition: Name of the breed of an animal that was identified for the unit.

label: NamedIndividual
definition: An individually named animal (e.g. a stallion in horsebreeding).

label: IdentificationQualifier
definition: A term to qualify the identification of the unit when doubts have arisen as to its identity (e.g. "cf." or "aff."). If this qualifier applies to an atomised name, the attribute insertionpoint defines the name element in front of which the qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before second epithet.)

label: insertionpoint
definition: The attribute @insertionpoint defines the name element in the scientific name identified for the unit before which the identification qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2 =  before first epithet, 3 = before second epithet).

label: NameAddendum
definition: A free-text suffix added to the taxon name identified, including additional name element in common use but without formal nomenclatural standing (e.g. isolate names for viruses).
examples: sensu lato; sensu stricto; isolate MH

label: InformalNameString
definition:
The outcome of an identification event for the unit that does not adhere to the rule of a Code of Nomenclature.

For botanicals, this is the name of the crop in colloquial language, preferably English.

definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.

label: NameComments
definition: Any free text comments related to the name identified for the unit.

definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Code
definition: The Code of Nomenclature that applies to the scientific name that is the result of the identification event for the unit.

label: MaterialIdentified
definition: A material identified as the result of the unit identification event (e.g. a non-organismic substrate of a microorganism).

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Extension
definition: A placeholder for a temporary extension to include non-taxonomic identification results not yet covered by the schema. This serves  to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema.

label: PreferredFlag
definition: The preferred flag is set to true to designate the current identification.

label: NonFlag
definition: The Non-Flag is set to true  to designate negative identifications.

label: StoredUnderFlag
definition: The Stored-Under-Flag is set to true to designate the idenfication under which the entire unit is stored (in a physical collection) or otherwise preferrably referenced.

label: ResultRole
definition: The result role is used to designate the role of the identification result.

label: Identifiers
definition: A container element for several identifiers for this unit.

label: Identifier
definition: The atomized record of the individual, team member, or organisation that made the unit identification.

label: PersonName
definition: Atomised data for the parts of the unit identifier's name.

label: FullName
definition:
The name of person as normally used representing the unit identifier.

The name may include titles.\nPreferred form of personal name for display as a string.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition:
The full name of the unit identifier in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomised name of the unit identifier.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the unit identifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the unit identifier's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition:
The suffix for the name of the unit identifier. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard: N-Suffix)

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the unit identifier. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the owner of the unit identifier. The preferred name may differ from the first given name. (vCard: Nickname)

label: Organisation
definition: The Organisation the unit identifier is affiliated with, or the organisation (institution) acting as the identifier.

label: OrganisationGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier for the organisation.

label: Name
definition:
A container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the unit identifier (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). (vCard: Org.Org-Name).

The Label mechanism also supports acronyms/abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

label: Representation
definition: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the unit identifier. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Text
definition: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the unit identifier.

label: Abbreviation
definition:
Label abbreviation representing the organisation of the unit identifier.

Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!).

Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: OrgUnits
definition: A container element for several organisation units that the unit identifier represents or to which the identifier may belong. (vCard: Org-Unit)

label: OrgUnit
definition: The organisational unit or subdivision with the organization, e.g. a department or working group.

definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: IdentifiersText
definition: Alternative text indicating the person, person team, or organisation that made the identification.

label: IdentificationSource
definition:
A (bibliographic) reference which has provided the unit identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the source given here.

It is not recommended to cite "field tag", or "determination slip" here as the source of the identification but to restrict this to published works. However, it is recommended to record the reference also when the specimen's identity is simply listed in the material examined section.

label: ReferenceGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the reference.

label: TitleCitation
definition: A formal citation for a paper or electronic publication that has provided the unit identification.

label: CitationDetail
definition: The specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference that has provided the unit identification.

label: URI
definition: The URL to an electronic source of the reference that has provided the unit identification.

label: DOI
definition: The digital object identifier (DOI) of the reference.

label: IdentifierRole
definition: An indication of the nature of the taxonomic verification (e.g. "conf." for a confirmation event or "det." for an identification for which full credit goes to the identifier).

label: References
definition: A container element for references that were used by the identifier to provide the identification (e.g. by means of providing a key or a description of the taxon). It circumscribes the taxon identified (and thus can act as a potential taxon's sec. reference).

label: Reference
definition: A reference (e.g. an article or monograph) that was used as the base for the identifier's taxon identification (e.g. by means of providing a key or a description of the taxon). It circumscribes the taxon identified (and thus can act as a potential taxon's sec. reference).

label: ReferenceGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the reference.

label: TitleCitation
definition: A formal citation for a paper or electronic publication that was used as the base for the identifier's taxon identification.

label: CitationDetail
definition: The specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference that was used as the base for the identifier's taxon identification.

label: URI
definition: The URL to an electronic source of the reference that was used as the base for the identifier's taxon identification.

label: DOI
definition: Digital object identifier for the reference.

label: Date
definition:
The date of the unit identification event. Identification dates are commonly incompletely known (e.g. only the year or year and month) or unknown. Sometimes identification dates are inferred from a researcher's visit or the duration of a loan.

The rather complex ABCD {{{DateTime}}} type is used, although many of its elements are not normally needed. As a rule, only the {{{IsoDateTimeBegin}}} element is mapped, which is the one used for searches and which can be used to construct identification histories. Alternatively, the {{{DateText}}} element can also be used, but it provides only for human readability.

However, the elements for exact time and periods may be useful for time series in laboratory reports that can be formulated as a series of identification events, or where the result of the identification may be influenced by the duration of a detection process.

label: DateText
definition:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date at which the unit identification event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.
examples: 25 [?] 1925; 3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]; Spring 1912; Late 1800s; End of 19th Century; Mid 1978; Easter 1933; Post WW2; Before June 25, 2000; After June 25, 2000

label: TimeZone
definition:
The time zone to which the time-of-day data for the unit identification event refer.

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema (http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

An integer between -840 and 840 inclusive (+/- 14 hours).

label: ISODateTimeBegin
definition: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period representing the unit identification event, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
usage: The date format looks like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS with flexible precision.

label: DayNumberBegin
definition:
The Julian day number (or sequential day) in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period representing the unit identification event. The year is given in ISO-Date-Time-Begin.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.

label: TimeOfDayBegin
definition:
Time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period representing the unit identification event.

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Time can also be expressed in the ISO {{{DateTimeElement}}}.

label: ISODateTimeEnd
definition: The end of the unit identification event expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured date format.
usage: The date format looks like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS with flexible precision.

label: DayNumberEnd
definition:
The Julian day number (sequential day within the year) of the last day in the unit identification event period.

The year is given in {{{ISODateTimeEnd}}}.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.

label: TimeOfDayEnd
definition:
The time of day in decimal hours from midnight local time for the end of the unit identification event period.

Note that times are decimal hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

label: PeriodExplicit
definition:
This is an indicator for the expliciteness of the unit identification event period.

This is set to 'true' if the unit identification event takes place for the period indicated. It is set to 'false' if it occurs at some point of time during the period, and is not filled if unknown or if no period is specified.

label: Method
definition: A description of the method by which the identification of the unit was obtained (e.g. details of molecular analysis or acoustical procedures).

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Notes
definition: Supplementary remarks about the unit identification.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: VerificationLevel
definition: The level to which the unit identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here.

label: IdentificationHistory
definition:
The history of identifications for this unit (assigned identification results).

This is a free text field for use when extracting data from datasources where the identification or verification history (or part of it) is a free text field.

Under normal circumstances the history can be constructed by sorting identification events by date and reference to the preferred identification flag.

label: RecordBasis
definition: A controlled vocabulary indicating what the unit record represents.

label: KindOfUnit
definition: Part(s), physical state, or class of materials represented by this specimen.
examples: whole organisms; antlers; bark; blood samples; bones; bulbs; claws; cocoons; DNA; eggs; extracts; feathers; feeding remains; fruits; galls; heads; hooves; horns; leaves; mixed; nests; pellets; pollen; roots; seeds; shells; skins; spores; teeth; wood; other

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: SampleType
definition: Category of material represented by this unit, e.g. DNA, RNA, tissue.

label: SpecimenUnit
definition: A Unit subtype containing data elements specific to physical specimens (living, fossil, or preserved).

label: Owner
definition:
The legal owner or the representative of the owner of the physical specimen.

In the case of permanent loans, this is normally the institution holding the specimen (i.e. not the legal owner), with its {{{Role}}} indicated in the respective element of the contact type. In that case, the actual owner is then registered under {{{Acquisition/AcquiredFrom}}}, with the {{{Role}}} of the owner specified in the respective element there.

label: Organisation
definition: Organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the specimen.

label: OrganisationGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier for the organisation.

label: Name
definition:
A container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name for the specimen owner (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). (vCard: Org.Org-Name).

The Label mechanism also supports acronyms/abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

label: Representation
definition: A language-specific label representation of the organisation name of the specimen owner. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

label: language

usage:

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Text
definition: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation of the legal owner of the specimen.

label: Abbreviation
definition:
Label abbreviation representing the organisation acting as or representing the legal owner of the specimen.

Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!).

Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: OrgUnits
definition: A container element for several organisation units that the specimen owner represents or to which the specimen owner may belong. (vCard: Org-Unit)

label: OrgUnit

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Person
definition: Person contact representing the owner of the specimen.

label: FullName
definition:
The name of person as normally used representing the specimen's legal owner.

The name may include titles.\nPreferred form of personal name for display as a string.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition:
The full name of the specimen owner in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomised name of the specimen owner.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the specimen owner. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the specimen owner's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition:
The suffix for the name of the specimen owner. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not.

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the specimen's legal owner. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the specimen owner. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

label: Roles
definition: A container element for several roles of the specimen owner.

label: Role
definition: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is the owner of the specimen. This element can be used to provide a title when no individual person is named.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Addresses
definition: A container element for several contact addresses for the specimen owner (person or organisation).

label: Address
definition:
A string representing the address of the specimen owner (person or organisation).

The attribute @preferred is used to indicate the preferred postal address.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: preferred
definition: The address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first used, the other addresses named should be regarded as alternate addresses.

label: TelephoneNumbers
definition: A container element for several telephone and fax numbers for the specimen owner (person or organisation).

label: TelephoneNumber
definition: Full telephone or fax number for the legal owner of the specimen.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  \n\nThe preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

label: preferred
definition: The telephone number marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other telephone numbers should be regarded as alternative numbers.

label: Number
definition: Full telephone or fax number of the specimen owner.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  \n\nThe preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

label: Device
definition: The type of device reached by the telephone number of the specimen owner.

label: UsageNotes
definition: Free text description of constraints on the use of the telephone number given for the person or organisation from whom the specimen was acquired. (e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number").

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: EmailAddresses
definition: A container element for several contact email addresses for the specimen owner (person or organisation).

label: EmailAddress
definition:
A valid contact email address for the owner of the specimen.

The @preferred attribute indicates a preferred email address.

label: preferred
definition: The email address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other email addresses named should be regarded as alternative email addresses.

label: URIs
definition: A container element for several URLs for websites representing the specimen owner (person or organisation).

label: URI
definition:
Publicly available URL for the person or organisation representing the legal owner of the specimen.

The @preferred attribute indicates the main URL.

label: preferred
definition: A flag to indicate that a URI is the preferred out of the multiple URIs specified.

label: LogoURI
definition: The URL of a logo image of the item or holding organisation representing the specimen owner. The logo image may give a quick indication of the source in result sets comprising data from several datasets.

label: LoanRestrictions
definition: Restrictions for accessing or loaning the specimen or sample.

label: BlockedUntil
definition: Date or year until the specimen or sample is not available for loan, often due to planned publications.

label: Blocked
definition: true or 1 if specimen or sample is blocked in general for loan

label: BlockedAsReferenceOnly
definition: Reference material only, can not be loaned, mostly because it is too valuable or almost gone.

label: LoanConditions
definition: certain conditions for loaning this specimen or sample

label: Acquisition
definition: The date, source, and type of the specimen acquisition by the institution.

label: AcquisitionDate

This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.
