label: NomenclaturalTypeDesignations
definition: A container element for several nomenclatural type designations.

label: NomenclaturalTypeDesignation
definition: Information on the type status of the specimen.

label: TypifiedName
definition: The name based on the specimen.

label: FullScientificNameString
definition: A concatenated scientific name for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, preferrably fully formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature (i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year), or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group.

label: NameAtomised
definition: Atomised data items of the taxon identified as the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

label: Botanical
definition: Atomised botanical name for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
One of the following, representing the genus, or higher taxon name, that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the unit.

A generic name as a botanical scientific name or as part of it.

A generic name under one of the established nomenclatural codes

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign,

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised.

2. No spaces included.

label: FirstEpithet
definition:
The first epithet in a botanical name combination that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (i.e. the epithet of a genus subdivision or a species epithet).

Rules:

1. No uppercase

2. No space

label: InfraspecificEpithet
definition:
The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

The infraspecific epithet (i.e. the epithet following the indication of the infraspecific rank in the name string (trinomial)). Rules:

1. No uppercase

2. No space

label: Rank
definition: The rank of the name that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, where needed to form it. (i.e. in infraspecies and in names of a rank between genus and species).

label: HybridFlag
definition: A flag indicating that the unit identified is a named hybrid ("x") or a graft chimaera ("+").

label: insertionpoint
definition: This attribute specifies the name element in front of which the hybrid flag should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before rank designation for second epithet.)

label: AuthorTeamParenthesis
definition:
Author team of the basionym of a combination that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet. May be preceded by a sanctioning author. If possible, preceding "ex" authors should be avoided.

label: AuthorTeam
definition:
The authors who published the full name as it stands that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Author(s) for the taxonomic name combination (i.e. the author team of the new combination where there is a basionym, and the name author team where there is none). May be preceded by a sanctioning author. If possible, preceding "ex" authors should be avoided.

label: CultivarGroupName
definition: The cultivar group that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, as specified in the ICNCP.

label: CultivarName
definition:
A cultivar name that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, as specified by the ICNCP.

For output, cultivar names must be enclosed in single quotes.

label: TradeDesignationNames
definition: A container for several trade names that are part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

label: TradeDesignationName
definition: A trade name used for a specific cultivar that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, as specified by the ICNCP.

label: Bacterial
definition: An atomised name for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, with elements according to the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
A generic name as a bacterial scientific name or as part of it that is a nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: Subgenus
definition:
A subgenus name as (part of) a bacterial scientific name that is a nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: SubgenusAuthorAndYear
definition: Author and year of the subgenus name that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

label: SpeciesEpithet
definition: The first epithet occurring in a bacterial name (after genus and, optionally, subgenus names) as part of a nomenclatural type designation for the unit.

label: SubspeciesEpithet
definition: The second epithet of a bacterial name of subspecies rank (after Genus, optional subgenus, and species epithet) as part of a nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

label: ParentheticalAuthorTeamAndYear
definition: Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies combination as part of a nomenclatural type designation for the specimen. Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet.

label: AuthorTeamAndYear
definition:
The author(s) who published the full name as it stands and the year of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Author(s) for the taxonomic name combination (i.e. the author team of the new combination where there is a basionym, and the name author team where there is none).
examples: Yamada and Kondo; Ames and Correll

label: NameApprobation
definition: Approbation of the name that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, according to an approved list, validation list,or validly published, paper in IJSB after 1980.

label: Viral
definition: Atomised viral name that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, with elements according to the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
A genus or higher taxon name formed according to the code, as part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (e.g. Comovirus).

A generic name as a scientific name of a virus or as part of it.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included

label: ViralSpeciesDesignation
definition: The formal name of a viral species, as part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen. (Examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1 [Source: ICTV]).
examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1

label: Acronym
definition: The accepted acronym for the virus that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (e.g. PCV for Peanut Clump Virus).

label: Zoological
definition: Atomized zoological name that is the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, with elements according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature.

label: GenusOrMonomial
definition:
A generic name as a zoological scientific name or as part of it that is used in the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Rules

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included.

label: Subgenus
definition:
A subgenus name as a zoological scientific name or as part of it that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

Rules:

1. First letter capitalised

2. No spaces included

label: SpeciesEpithet
definition: The first epithet occurring in a zoological name that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (after genus and, optionally, subgenus names).

label: SubspeciesEpithet
definition: The second epithet of a zoological name of subspecies rank that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (after genus, optional subgenus, and species epithet).

label: AuthorTeamOriginalAndYear
definition:
The original authors and year of publication of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

The first person(s) who validly published a species-group name and the year of publication.

label: AuthorTeamParenthesisAndYear
definition:
The parenthetical author and year of publication for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

The parenthetical citation of the original author when a species-group was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication for a name identified for the unit.

Author(s) of the original name for a taxon which has subsequently been revised but retains the same stem or epithet and the year of the original publication.

Rule: Set in parenthesis upon output

label: CombinationAuthorTeamAndYear
definition:
The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination for the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, and the year of its publication.

The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination when a species-group is transferred to another genus and the year of publication of the transfer.

label: Breed
definition: Name of the breed of an animal as part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen.

label: NamedIndividual
definition: An individually named animal, as part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen (e.g. a stallion in horsebreeding).

label: NomenclaturalReference
definition: A published reference.

label: ReferenceGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the reference.

label: TitleCitation
definition: A formal citation for a paper or electronic publication that is a nomenclatural reference.

label: CitationDetail
definition: The specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the nomenclatural reference.

label: URI
definition: The URL to an electronic source of the nomenclatural reference.

label: DOI
definition: The digital object identifier (DOI) of the reference.

label: TypeStatus
definition:
A full term designating the status of the nomenclatural type designation.

Darwin Core 2: Type Status.

label: CodeAssessment
definition: An indication of whether the type is conserved or rejected/suppressed by the Code, or is proposed for conservation or suppression/rejection.

label: DoubtfulFlag
definition: An indicator for unverified type status (kind and fact).

label: Verifier
definition: The person assigning or verifying the type status of the specimen.

label: FullName
definition:
The name of person as normally used representing the type status verifier.

The name may include titles.\nPreferred form of personal name for display as a string.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition:
The full name of the type status verifier in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically.

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomised name of the type status verifier.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the type status verifier. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the type status verifier's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition: The suffix for the name of the type status verifier. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the type status verifier. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the type status verifier. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

label: VerificationDate
definition: The date of the verification of the type status of the specimen.

label: VerificationNotes
definition: Further information about the type status verification process.

label: LoanSequenceNo
definition: The sequence of a specimen within a given loan, assigned with the Loan Identification to uniquely identify a specimen on loan [HISPID3].

label: LoanDestination
definition: Institution to which the loan is being sent.

label: LoanForBotanist
definition: Name of the botanist for whom the loan is destined [HISPID3].

label: LoanDespatchMethod
definition: The means by which the loan is being despatched from the home institution.

label: LoanDate
definition: The date the loan is prepared and/or sent [HISPID3].

label: LoanReturnDate
definition: The date the loan is to be returned.

definition: Data specific to units in botanical live (horticultural) collections.

label: AccessionSpecimenNumbers
definition:
The minimum numbers of individuals the garden is holding under the UnitID.

Rule: Accession status must not be D (dead).

label: AccessionStatus
definition: The current status of the accession in the garden.

label: LocationInGarden
definition: The current location of the living plant in the botanical garden.

label: AccessionMaterialType
definition: The type of material the current living accession is composed of.

label: Hardiness
definition: A flag indicating that the accession is grown outdoors in the botanical garden.

label: ProvenanceCategory
definition:
A code to indicate the provenance of the accession [ITF-2].

W (Accession of wild source)

Z (Propagule/s from a wild source plant in cultivation)

G (Accession not of wild source)

U (Insufficient data to determine which category applies)

Field definition taken from ITF 2, see there for further description.

label: PropagationHistoryCode
definition:
A code to indicate the nature of the production of the plant material being accessioned, for use in association with the element {{{ProvenanceCategory}}}.

Field definition taken from ITF 2.
One of the following values: I, S, SA, SB, SC, V, VA, VB, U.

label: AccessionLineage
definition: The purpose of this element is to trace the lineage of an accession to either one or two immediate parent unit ID's. The Unit IDs are preceded by the garden code (Heywood and Heywood)

label: DonorCategory
definition:
A code to indicate the type of the immediate donor from which the accession was obtained. This may not necessarily be the original collector of wild material. [ITF-2]

One or more of the following characters: E, G, B, R, S, U, H, M, N, I, O, U.

Field definition taken from ITF 2.

label: Cultivation
definition: Allows for cultivation information to be passed as free text in order to help the receiving garden care for the transferred accession [ITF-2] or to record the garden's experience made with this accession.

label: PlantingDate
definition: The date in ISO format the plant was planted at its current location in the botanical garden.

label: Propagation
definition: Allows for information about any propagation requirements to be passed as free text in order to help the receiving garden propagate the transferred accession [ITF-2] or to record the garden's experience made with this accession.

label: Perennation
definition: A code to indicate the means of perennation, providing a means of noting living plant accessions that require regular curatorial monitoring.

label: BreedingSystem
definition: A code to indicate the breeding system of the accession [ITF-2].

label: IPEN
definition: A unique number given to plant materials accessioned in conformance with the rules of the International Plant Exchange Network (see http://www.bgci.org/abs/ipen_numbers.html ).

label: PlantGeneticResourcesUnit
definition: Extension for elements only used in plant genetic resource collections. Currently, all elements represent EURISCO descriptors.

label: NationalInventoryCode
definition: A code identifying the National Inventory. The code of the country preparing the National Inventory. Exceptions are possible, if agreed with EURISCO such as NGB.

label: BreedingInstitutionCode
definition:
FAO Institute Code of the institute that has bred the material.

The codes consist of the 3-letter ISO 3166 country code of the country where the institute is located plus a three-digit number.

label: BreedingCountryCode
definition: 3-letter ISO code for the country where the breeding institute is located.

label: BiologicalStatus
definition: Code for the (propagation-)provenance of the unit.

label: AncestralData
definition: Information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (i.e. parent variety in case of mutant or selection). A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
examples: Hanna/7*Atlas//Turk/8*Atlas; mutation found in HannaExample: selection from Irene; cross involving amongst others Hanna and Irene

definition:
Code for the (location-) provenance of the unit.

The coding scheme proposed can be used at 2 different levels of detail: either by using the general codes (in boldface) such as 10, 20, 30, 40 or by using the more specific codes such as 11, 12 etc. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.
10) Wild habitat
11) Forest/woodland
12) Shrubland
13) Grassland
14) Desert/tundra
15) Aquatic habitat

20) Farm or cultivated habitat
21) Field
22) Orchard
23) Backyard, kitchen or home garden (urban, peri-urban or rural)
24) Fallow land
25) Pasture
26) Farm store
27) Threshing floor
28) Park

30) Market or shop

40) Institute, Experimental station, Research organisation, Genebank

50) Seed company

60) Weedy, disturbed or ruderal habitat
61) Roadside
62) Field margin

99) Other (Elaborate in REMARKS field)

label: OtherIdentification
definition:
Any other identification (numbers) known to exist in other collections for this accession.

Use the following system: {{{INSTCODE:ACCENUMB;INSTCODE:ACCENUMB;}}}

INSTCODE and ACCENUMB follow the standard described above and are separated by a colon. Pairs of INSTCODE and ACCENUMB are separated by a semicolon without space. When the institute is not known, the number should be preceded by a colon.

label: LocationSafetyDuplicates
definition: The FAO Institute Code of the institute where a safety duplicate of the accession is maintained. The codes consist of the 3-letter ISO 3166 country code of the country where the institute is located plus a number.

label: TypeGermplasmStorage

label: DateText
definition:
A text version (alphabetic mixed case and integer) of the date that the gathering event took place. This element is meant for use when the date is imprecise, ambiguous or not in a form that satisfies the standard structured date format. It can also be used when it is important to record the verbatim representation of the date or when dates to be recorded are not completely legible. For example the day and month may be decipherable but not the year; the use of this field will allow recording of partially interpreted information.

This field can be used to record generalised date ranges and irresolvable ambiguity such as different day/month order conventions (e.g. US/Europe) or to allow for multiple dates and periods.

In the rare instances of dates for periods before the year 0000, BC and similar dates can be recorded in this field.
examples: 25 [?] 1925; 3/9/45 [ambiguous day month]; Spring 1912; Late 1800s; End of 19th Century; Mid 1978; Easter 1933; Post WW2; Before June 25, 2000; After June 25, 2000

label: TimeZone

Timezone expressed in minutes in accordance with the "seven property model" for date/time attributes in XML schema ( http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/WD-xmlschema11-2-20040716/#theSevenPropertyModel).

An integer between -840 and 840 inclusive (+/- 14 hours).

This field may apply to times of collecting where this is considered important.

Note that times are decimial hours: 13.5 represents 1:30 pm, not 1:05 pm, nor 1:50 pm.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Time of Day.

label: ISODateTimeEnd

The year is given in ISO {{{DateTimeEnd}}}.

The content range is 1-365 for normal years, 366 for leap years.

label: TimeOfDayEnd

Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the gathering agent's inherited name. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition: The suffix for the name of the gathering agent.  The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the gathering agent. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the gathering agent. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc.) (vCard: Nickname).

label: GatheringAgentsText
definition: A free text representation or concatenated version of those responsible for collecting or recording.

label: Permits
definition: A container element for references to (or texts of) permits related to the gathering.

label: Permit
definition: A reference to or the text of a permit related to the gathering.

label: PermitInfo
examples: Permit available; not required; not available

label: PermitType
definition: Description of permit type, e.g. Collecting permit, import permit, export permit

label: Project
definition: Project information concerning the gathering event.

label: ProjectTitle
definition: The project name if of special importance or cited on a collection label.
examples: Inventory of the Montecristo National Park

label: Contact
definition: Contact details for the project officer or another person with knowledge about the gathering project.

label: Organisation
definition: The name and code(s) of the organisation to contact for information about the gathering project.

label: OrganisationGUID
definition: A globally unique identifier for the organisation.

label: Name
definition: A container element for several language-specific representations of the full organisation or corporate name of the gathering project information contact (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). (vCard: Org.Org-Name). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms/abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

label: Representation
definition: A language-specific label representation of the name of the organisation to contact for information about the gathering project. The attribute @language lets you specify the language, the Representation mechanism makes it possible to ensure that only one name per language is specified.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Text
definition: Label text in a specific language representing the organisation to contact for information about the gathering project.

label: Abbreviation
definition:
Label abbreviation representing the organisation to contact for information about the gathering project.

Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (shorter recommended!).

Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: OrgUnits
definition: A container element for several organisation units to contact for information about the gathering project.

label: OrgUnit
definition: The organisational unit or subdivision with the organization, e.g. a department or working group.

label: Person
definition: The person to contact for information about the gathering project.

label: FullName
definition:
The name of person as normally used representing the person to contact for information about the gathering project.

The name may include titles.\nPreferred form of personal name for display as a string.
examples: Professor James Hundredwidth; Aylstone T. McTrace

label: SortingName
definition:
The full name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project in a form appropriate for sorting alphabetically. (vCard: Sort-String)

The form consists of the following: Family name first followed by a comma then a space then given names or initials separated by a space.

label: AtomisedName
definition: Atomised name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project.

label: InheritedName
definition: The inherited name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project. This may consist of family names, generational names, a clan name, parents or grandparents personal names, etc. The inherited name (this being the lastname in western cultures) may be compound (e.g. 'Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture, the inherited name is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to a married couple. Therefore, 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard (vCard: N-Family).

label: Prefix
definition: The prefix to the inherited name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project. The prefix should be output before the name, but is usually not included in sorting. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard: N-Prefix)

label: Suffix
definition: The suffix for the name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project. The suffix should be output after the name, regardless of whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not (vCard: N-Suffix).

label: GivenNames
definition: The personal name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project. The name given to the person as a personal name (the first or christian name in western cultures, including middle initials). The given name may contain several words. It is applicable only to people (vCard: N-Given + vCard: N-Middle).
examples: Wen; Jerry B.; Maria Teresa; Ichiro; Hans-Werner

label: PreferredName
definition: The preferred name of the person to contact for information about the gathering project. The preferred name may differ from the first given name (e.g. second given name, nickname (vCard: Nickname).

label: Roles
definition: A container element for several roles held by the contact person for the gathering project.

label: Role
definition: Title for the role of the person or organisation that is acting as or representing the specimen preparation agent. This element can be used to provide a title when no individual person is named.

label: language

label: Addresses
definition: A container element for several addresses for the gathering project contact person or organisation.

label: Address
definition:
A string representing the address of the gathering project contact (person or organisation).

The attribute @preferred is used to indicate the preferred postal address.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:

label: preferred
definition: The address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other addresses named should be regarded as alternate addresses.

label: TelephoneNumbers
definition: A container element for several telephone and fax numbers for the gathering project contact (person or organisation).

label: TelephoneNumber
definition: Telephone or fax number for the gathering project contact.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  \n\nThe preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

label: preferred
definition: The telephone number marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other telephone numbers should be regarded as alternative numbers.

label: Number
definition: Full telephone or fax number of the gathering project contact.
usage: Numbers should be provided in the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) international format ("+Country-Code Area-Code Number").  \n\nThe preferred attribute @preferred indicates the preferred number.

label: Device
definition: The type of device reached by the telephone number of the gathering project contact.

label: UsageNotes
definition: Free text describing constraints on use of the telephone number of the gathering project contact (e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number").

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: EmailAddresses
definition: A container element for several contact email addresses for the gathering project contact (person or organisation).

label: EmailAddress
definition:
A valid contact email address for the gathering project contact.

The @preferred attribute indicates a preferred email address.

label: preferred
definition: The email address marked as preferred by means of this attribute should be the first approached. The other email addresses named should be regarded as alternative email addresses.

label: URIs
definition: A container element for several URLs for websites representing the gathering project contact (person or organisation).

label: URI
definition:
Publicly available URL for the person or organisation representing the gathering project contact.

The @preferred attribute indicates the main URL.

label: preferred
definition: A flag to indicate that a URI is the preferred out of the multiple URIs specified.

label: LogoURI
definition: The URL of a logo image of the item or holding organisation representing the gathering project contact. The logo image may give a quick indication of the source in result sets comprising data from several datasets.

label: PlatformName
definition: The platform from which observations or collections were made (e.g. the name of a research vessel or a remote operated vehicle).

label: Method
definition: The method (including technical means) used to make the collection or observation.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: ValidDistributionFlag
definition: A flag ("true" or "false") that indicates whether the locality information represents a valid distribution occurrence for a specimen. Specimens taken from captivity and showing the captive location should use the value "false". [DwC 1.4 Concept List r33.]

label: EstablishmentMeans
definition: The historical relationship of the occurrence to the cited time and place of collection or observation. Examples: 'wild', 'captive', 'cultivated', 'cultivated ex wild', 'persisting from cultivation' [DwC discussion]

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: LocalityText
definition:
The original gathering locality data as appearing on a label or in an original entry, as a text string. This field should be transcribed verbatim from the specimen label.

Location information below the country level that describes where the accession was collected. This might include the distance in kilometres and direction from the nearest town, village or map grid reference point. A FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), description and examples taken from EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002.

Where possible, the language of the label locality should be indicated with the language attribute.

Editorial omissions for brevity, etc. should be indicated with an ellipsis (...) and interpreted or implied text should be included in square brackets [ ].
examples: New Caledonia, below summit region of Mt Mou.; New South Wales, Central Tablelands 12 km SW of Armidale.; 7 km south of Curitiba in the state of Parana

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: Country
definition:
Details about the gathering country, such as the representation of the country and its name. This is separate from {{{NamedArea}}} for compatibility reasons.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Country through either {{{ISO2Letter}}} (future) or {{{CountryName}}} (current). Historical country names and water bodies outside the coastal zone can be entered under named area.

{{{CountryNameDerived}}} is provided for a country name that has been derived (e.g.from a system supplied dictionary) by library consultation or other independent research.

At least one of {{{CountryName}}} or {{{ISO2}}} or {{{ISO3}}} should be present but more are allowed. This should be the political country having jurisdiction over the collection site.

label: Name
definition:
The full name of the country or major region where the specimen was collected, or the observation made.

The use of this element is slightly ambiguous in that local practice might require either a verbatim quote from specimen labels, or standardisation by controlled vocabulary or lookup lists.

It is recommended that the spelling of the country be that which is recognised by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

For cases where country names or boundaries have changed, it is recommended that new country names be enclosed in square brackets, after the old country name. The 2-letter ISO codes in the ISO Code for Country of Origin field assist with updating and cross referencing country names where boundaries change.

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX' or 'XY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.
examples: Australia; Commonwealth of Australia; Iceland; Republic of Iceland; Samoa; Independent State of Samoa

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: NameDerived
definition:
The derived full name of the country or major region where the specimen was collected, or the observation made, interpreted in the light of contemporary geographical knowledge.

The use of this element is slightly ambiguous in that local practice might require either a verbatim quote from specimen labels, or standardisation by controlled vocabulary or lookup lists.

It is recommended that the spelling of the country should be that which is recognised by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

The derived country name offers the opportunity to document the name under which a country is currently known, interpreted from an old or superceded name on the specimen label (e.g. Vanuatu for the New Hebrides, Sri Lanka for Ceylon, etc).

Separate fields for state/province and country are needed to adequately handle the situation with international collections.

If the name of the country where the plant was collected is unknown, then this field should contain the value 'UNKNOWN'. In this case, the ISO Code for Country of Origin field must have the entry 'XX', 'XY', 'XXX', or 'XXY'. All remaining 'location group' fields should be left unfilled.
examples: Sri Lanka; Taiwan; Vanuatu; Papua New Guinea; Kiribati; East Timor

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: ISO3166Code
definition:
The 2-, 3-, or 4-letter code for the representation of the name of the gathering country using the codes assigned by the International Standards Organisation (ISO).

This field should contain a valid entry as defined by the International Standards Organisation (ISO Standard 3166-1), with the following exception: The 'XXX' or 'XX' code should be used when no country of origin information is provided. The 'XXY' or 'XY' code should be used for non-specific collecting localities, e.g. Africa, SouthEast Asia.
examples: AU; ES; FR; PG; US; AUS; ESP; FRA; USA; DDDE

label: NamedAreas
definition: A container element for several named areas for the collection or observation site.

label: NamedArea
definition:
An atomised place name with possibility for hierarchical structuring. An attribute for sequence can be used.

The name and category of an administrative or geoecological area.

label: sequence
definition: A number indicating the sequence of several named areas describing the gathering site.

label: AreaClass
definition:
Allows the recording of classification categories for the class of the gathering named area (local or national subdivision levels, geomorphological units, protected areas, etc.)

These classification categories are often treated as individual elements in other standards.
examples: County; District; State; Municipio; Island; Island group; Water body; Drainage; National park; Mountain

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: AreaName
definition: Name of the gathering area (a geographic, geomorphological, geoecological, or administrative area).
examples: Atlantic coast; Santa Cruz; Weinheim; Andes; El Imposible

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: AreaCodeStandard
definition: The standard coding scheme the {{{AreaCode}}} for the gathering area adheres to. The name of a standard scheme for area codes.
examples: Euro+Med standard territories; TDWG World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions version 1

label: AreaCode
definition: An abbreviation or code for the gathering area name.

label: DataSource
definition: The data source used to determine the corresponding named area.

label: NearNamedPlaces
definition: A container element for several specified relationships to named places that do not directly apply to the site of collection or observation (e. g. 10 Km South of Mytown).

label: NamedPlaceRelation
definition: An indication of the location of the gathering site by means of stating a (usually nearby) named place and the relation to it (e.g. giving a distance and cardinal points, or just a distance, or a road distance).

label: DerivedFlag
definition: A flag indicating that the name of - or the relation to - the place is not that originally indicated by the collector, but has been derived (e.g. by means of transforming a historical place name to a modern one, by translating the place name, by tranforming values like "upriver" to compass bearings, etc.)

label: NearNamedPlace
definition: A place name that does not directly apply to the collection or observation location, but is more or less specifically related to it (the relationship can be described with the element {{{NamedPlaceRelation}}}.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: NearNamedPlaceRelationTo
definition: The relation of the gathering site to a different named place, preferrably by distance and directional point.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: AreaDetail
definition: Additional gathering locality details not covered by the named area or nearest named place elements.

label: language
definition: The language of the text in the element carrying this attribute, according to RFC 3066.
usage:
The value UND (undefined) should be used if the language cannot be set for some reason. However, use of UND is discouraged by the W3 consortium.

Recommended values are defined by the following reference: H. Alvestrand, ed. RFC 3066: Tags for the Identification of Languages 1995. Available at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt .

label: GML
definition: Spaceholder for GML-conformant schema extension to express the spatial representation of the gathering locality including coordinates, footprint, and uncertainties in GML (Geographical Markup Language). The GML application schema developed by the BioGeomancer Project (see http://www.biogeomancer.org) can be used here.

label: WFS
definition: Retrieval of a boundary polygon or centroid spatial reference relating to the gathering site. URL (GET) or POST text, for Web Feature Service (OpenGIS Consortium Specification 01-023) reference.

label: WMSURL
definition: A URI for the location of a boundary polygon or centroid spatial reference relating to a gathering site, according to the Web Map Services (WMS) specification of the Open GIS Consortium.

label: SiteCoordinateSets
definition: A container for several sets of coordinates indicating the collection or observation site.

label: SiteCoordinates
definition:
A composite element to allow for the recording of multiple coordinates or the same coordinates in different systems.

Attributes are available for original data and for the beginning and end of a sequence.

label: CoordinateMethod
definition: A coordinates measuring system used for the gathering site coordinates

label: GeoreferenceSources
definition: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] A list of maps, gazetteers or other resources used to georeference the locality. The content of this concept is meant to be specific enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resource to georeference the same locality. Example: "USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad".

label: GeoreferenceVerificationStatus
definition: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the location where the specimen or observation was collected. This element should be vocabulary-controlled. Examples: "requires verification", "verified by collector", "verified by curator".

label: GeoreferenceRemarks
definition: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] Comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in GeoreferenceProtocol.

label: CoordinatesUTM
definition: A container for coordinates expressed for the Universal Transverse Mercator projection.

label: UTMZone
definition:
The numerical Zone corresponding to the central meridian and origin upon which the UTM Easting is based.

(values constrained to be an integer between 1 and 60, inclusive)

label: UTMSubzone
definition:
The Subzone letter corresponding to one of the 20 North-South
divisions of the UTM grid system. (values constrained to be a single
capital letter in the set {C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, Q, R, S, T,
U, V, W, X}).

label: UTMNS
definition:
The hemisphere to which the UTMNorthing refers. This designation is
often, though unofficially, used instead of the Subzone.

(values constrained to language-dependent versions of north and south, and their abbreviations - most commonly the set {N,S}).

label: UTMZoneFull
definition: UTM Zone and Subzone concatenated into a single string.

label: UTMEasting
definition: The distance in meters east of the origin of the UTMZone. (values constrained to be integers between 166000 and 834000)

label: UTMNorthing
definition:
The distance in meters north of the origin for the UTMSubzone. For the northern hemisphere (UTMSubzones M through X) the origin is at the equator. For the southern hemisphere (Subzones C through L), the origin is at 10000 meters south of the equator.

(values constrained to be integers between 0 and 10000)

label: UTMDatum
definition: Mathematical surface on which the mapping and coordinate system used for the geocodes of the record are based

label: UTMText
definition: Normally a combination of the values for UTMZone, subzone, easting and northing.

label: CoordinatesGrid
definition: Geospatial coordinates for the gathering site recorded using a grid system.

label: GridCellSystem
definition: The name of the grid system used for the gathering site coordinates.

label: GridCellCode
definition: The code of the grid system used to record the gathering site coordinates.

label: GridQualifier
definition: A grid reference precision qualifier for the gathering site coordinates.

label: CoordinatesLatLong
definition: An element that allows the recording of the latitude and longitude of a recording or collecting position.

label: LongitudeDecimal
definition:
The longitude of the gathering site, expressed in decimal degrees.

Degrees (3 digits), minutes (2 digits), and seconds (2 digits) followed by E (East) or W (West). Every missing digit (minutes or seconds) should be indicated with a hyphen. Leading zeros are required.

label: VerbatimLongitude
definition: Equivalent to the respective element in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

label: LatitudeDecimal
definition:
The latitude of the gathering site, expressed in decimal degrees.

Degrees (2 digits), minutes (2 digits), and seconds (2 digits) followed by N (North) or S (South). Every missing digit (minutes or seconds) should be indicated with a hyphen. Leading zeros are required.

label: VerbatimLatitude
definition: Equivalent to the respective element in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

label: SpatialDatum
definition: A mathematical surface on which the mapping and coordinate system used for the geocodes of the gathering site are based.\nEquivalent to "GeodeticDatum" in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

label: AccuracyStatement
definition: A free text statement of the degree of accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates.

label: CoordinateErrorDistanceInMeters
definition:
An estimate of how tightly the collecting locality was specified, expressed as a distance in meters corresponding to a radius around the Lat/Long coordinates.

Use NULL where the precision is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable.

Maps to Darwin Core 2: Coordinate Precision.

label: CoordinateErrorMethod
definition: Verbatim statement of how the Coordinate Error was determined.

label: PointRadiusSpatialFit
definition: DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4: ] A measure of how well the circle defined by the coordinates and uncertainty match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the circle to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The PointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the PointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006).

label: CoordinatesText
definition: An alternative concatenated text representation of the lat/lon coordinates

label: Altitude
definition: The altitude of the gathering site land or floor level, given as distance above (positive) or below mean sea level. Although the altitude could be covered by the generic element for site measurements, the separate altitude element is preserved for the sake of clarity.

label: MeasurementOrFactAtomised
definition: Atomised data describing a measurement or fact recording for the altitude of the gathering  site.

label: MeasuredBy

A generic name under one of the established nomenclatural codes

A manuscript name

An intergeneric hybrid name under the ICBN, without the leading multiplication sign,

The name of an intergeneric graft hybrid or graft chimaera, published under the Cultivated Code.

definition: A trade name used for a specific cultivar that is part of the nomenclatural type designation for the specimen, as specified by the ICNCP.

This is measured in either letters (e.g. NE, SW) or Degrees (e.g. 270).

This information is of particular interest in relation to exposure and incident sunlight.

The values in these fields are nearly always directional and restricted to mountainous or sloping ground.

The value 'Open' can be used to describe flat plains or exposed ridge crests; 'Closed' can be used for valleys or ravines.

This may be used for recording the aspect of a site or as part of the dip/strike measurement in geologic records.

label: FootprintWKT
definition: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3]. A Well-Known Text (WKT; see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text) representation of the the shape (footprint) that defines the location of the occurrence. Example: the one-degree box with opposite corners at (longitude=10, latitude=20) and (longitude=11, latitude=21) would be expressed in well-known text as POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))

label: FootprintSpatialFit
definition: [DwC Geospacial Extension Schema v. 0.3] A measure of how well the geometry expressed in the footprint match the original spatial representation, as a ratio of the area of the footprint given to the area of the original spatial representation. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given georeference does not completely contain the original representation. The FootprintSpatialFit is undefined if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the FootprintSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Guide to Best Practices for Georeferencing (Chapman and Wieczorek, eds. 2006)

label: CollectorsFieldNumber

This identifier should be added to the entry (for collectors) under {{{Gathering/GatheringAgents/../Person}}}, if such an entry exists. However, the collector (or collector abbreviation) and number can also be given in a single field (e.g. FAO/IPGRI multi-crop passport descriptor (MCPD), described in the EURISCO descriptor list dated July 3, 2002). label: UnitExtension
definition:
The extension is temporary and serves only to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema [in the future to the the various schemas/objects used in ABCD].

For example, if a specific community (e.g. culture collections) discover that there are elements missing in the current version of ABCD (as they did for 1.2), they communicate that to the group responsible for schema development, who will discuss whether these elements are already accommodated in the schema, if they are not and if they can and should be generalized, and where they should end up in the schema. IF the culture collection community needs to move rapidly (e.g. due to project pressures), they can add these elements to the current version as an extension schema under a structure that follows SDD's CustomExtensions element (CustomExtensions-CustomExtension-Any ##other). In future modular versions of ABCD, such a structure should exist in the root of every object/schema.
